data: GENSURG/NEPH Parathyroidectomy in Dialysis Patient - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase.  These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discontinue GENSURG Thyroid / Parathyroid -  Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Thyroid / Parathyroid Surgery Clinical Pathway (if applicable to site)

Monitor q1h for 4 hours, then q2h for 4 hours, then q4h for hypocalcemia, and notify provider for any signs and symptoms include: tetany, tingling toes or fingers, numbness around the lips, muscular twitches
Notify Nephrology Consult Team for any signs and symptoms include: tetany, tingling toes or fingers, numbness around the lips, muscular twitches
q1h for 4 hours then q4h. Monitor for neck swelling
q2h for 4 hours then q4h. Monitor for neck swelling
T+2;N, Site: Surgical Incision(s), Leave dressings to primary closed wounds for 48 hours (unless directed)
Have suture scissors or staple remover at bedside
Hemovac strip q1h for 4 hour then q6h PRN
T+1;0800, Remove if output less than 30 mL drainage post-op day 1
T+1;0800, Remove if output less than 5 mL drainage post-op day 1
Discontinue lanthanum, sevelamer and cinacalcet if patient taking prior to admission
No heparin during dialysis until approved by surgeon
3 mcg, PO, BID, drug form: cap
1 mcg, PO, BID, drug form: cap
2 mcg, PO, BID, drug form: cap
1,000 mg, (elem calcium 1000 mg = calcium carbonate 2500 mg), PO, TID, drug form: tab
1,500 mg, (elem calcium 1500 mg = calcium carbonate 3750 mg), PO, TID, drug form: tab
2 g, IV, as directed, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 15 minute, drug form: inj
calcium gluconate titratable infusion (20 mg/mL) in D5W
titrate, IV, starting rate: 1 g/h, minimum rate: 0 g/h, maximum rate: 2 g/h, titrate instructions: as per infusion instructions
Venous Thromboembolism (VTE) Prophylaxis - Post Operative Surgery (Module)
Blood, Timed, Collection: T+1;0600, q24h for 2 week
Whole Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Whole Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Whole Blood, Timed, Collection: T:N+360, once
Whole Blood, Timed, Collection: T:N+360, once
Blood, Timed, Collection: T+1;0700, q24h for 2 week
Whole Blood, Timed, Collection: T+1;0700, q24h for 2 week
Whole Blood, Timed, Collection: T+1;0700, q24h for 2 week
Blood, Timed, Collection: T+1;1500, q24h for 2 week
Whole Blood, Timed, Collection: T+1;1500, q24h for 2 week
Whole Blood, Timed, Collection: T+1;1500, q24h for 2 week
Plan for discharge home when iCa above 1.1 mmol/L AND off IV calcium infusion for 24 hours
Contact Nephrology Consult Team prior to discharge
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
For a new fever greater than 38.5 C
On admission, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hour, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hour, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hour, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
On admission, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hour, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hour, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hour, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
q1h for 2 hour, then  q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hours, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hours, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hours, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then  q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hours, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
T;N, Start: NPO, Adjust/Advance Diet to: Renal, Hemodialysis, NPO until fully awake. When awake assess swallowing for dysphagia
TKVO as per site policy, IV, drug form: bag
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients Eating or NPO (Sliding Scale) (Module)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 88 - 92 %, for COPD patients
Reason for Consult: Other (see special instructions), When patient awake, assess swallowing for dysphagia and need for oral supplements
Reason for Consult: Involuntary Weight Loss
